## albumSchema variable

Metadata output by this library. It consists of passed-through input metadata conforming to `metadataSchema` combined with an array of `photoSchema` metadata for all photos inside the album directory.

Use this schema in your downstream application to easily load the JSON files, see the example under `albumSchemaType`<!-- -->.

**Signature:**

```typescript
albumSchema: z.ZodObject<{
    title: z.ZodString;
    description: z.ZodOptional<z.ZodString>;
    thumb: z.ZodOptional<z.ZodString>;
    keywords: z.ZodOptional<z.ZodArray<z.ZodString, "many">>;
    unlisted: z.ZodBoolean;
    slug: z.ZodString;
    photos: z.ZodArray<z.ZodObject<{
        filename: z.ZodString;
        date: z.ZodString;
        landscape: z.ZodBoolean;
        w: z.ZodNumber;
        h: z.ZodNumber;
    }, "strict", z.ZodTypeAny, {
        filename: string;
        date: string;
        landscape: boolean;
        w: number;
        h: number;
    }, {
        filename: string;
        date: string;
        landscape: boolean;
        w: number;
        h: number;
    }>, "many">;
}, "strict", z.ZodTypeAny, {
    title: string;
    slug: string;
    unlisted: boolean;
    photos: {
        filename: string;
        date: string;
        landscape: boolean;
        w: number;
        h: number;
    }[];
    description?: string | undefined;
    thumb?: string | undefined;
    keywords?: string[] | undefined;
}, {
    title: string;
    slug: string;
    unlisted: boolean;
    photos: {
        filename: string;
        date: string;
        landscape: boolean;
        w: number;
        h: number;
    }[];
    description?: string | undefined;
    thumb?: string | undefined;
    keywords?: string[] | undefined;
}>
```

## Remarks

Although the schema extends `metadataSchema`<!-- -->, several of the fields are no longer optional and are written with defaults by the library:

1. `title` defaults to album on-disk folder name, case preserved (e.g. 'Album1')

2. `slug` defaults to album on-disk folder name, lower cased (e.g. 'album1')

3. `unlisted` defaults to false

## Example

Sample output JSON file

```json
{
  "title": "My Album",
  "description": "An album of photos",
  "thumb": "IMG_1234.jpg",
  "slug": "my-album",
  "unlisted": "false",
  "keywords": ["array of keywords", "landscapes", "art"],
  "photos": [{
    "filename": "IMG_2851.jpg",
    "date": "Thu Jan 07 2010 09:52:59 GMT-0800 (Pacific Standard Time)",
    "w": 1064,
    "h": 1600,
    "landscape": false
  },
  {
    "filename": "IMG_2944.jpg",
    "date":"Thu Jan 07 2010 19:10:00 GMT-0800 (Pacific Standard Time)",
    "w": 1600,
    "h": 1064,
    "landscape": true
  }]
}
```
